intro: Euphrasia masamuneana, commonly known as the Masamune's eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in early spring. The plant features hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves, which are often covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
